DOC.brief_summary: 1 . OBJECTIVE : To determine efficacy safety single-incision mini-sling compare transobturator midurethral sling stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) treatment . 2 . METHODS : This prospective single-center randomize control trial involve 100 woman diagnosis SUI . Primary outcomes objective subjective cure rate , define negative cough stress pad test , satisfaction rate . Quality life assess Incontinence Quality Life Questionnaire Urogenital Distress Inventory Short Form , operation time , complication , reoperation rate also record . The efficacy analyze use noninferiority test margin 15 % . For noninferiority test , P value > .05 reject noninferiority hypothesis mini-sling .
DOC.brief_title: Transobturator Sling Compared With Single-incision Mini-sling Treatment Stress Urinary Incontinence
DOC.criteria: Patients age 18 year Clinical urodynamic diagnosis stress urinary incontinence Absence associate neurological disease No clinically significant detrusor instability ( ie , determine symptom proportionally significant patient incontinence effort ) urodynamic change suggest reduction bladder capacity , bladder compliance suggestive bladder outlet obstruction Coagulopathies Pregnancy History sensitivity foreign body Acute Urinary Tract Infection Sequelae high exposure ionize radiation Use drug result high / risk significant postoperative complication surgical risk , include drug interferes blood clot anesthetic contraindication procedure Vulvovaginitis : presence vaginal discharge laboratory proven infection
